blog.name: hamliet
blog.title: to write or not to write
blog.description: I write meta & fic for stories I like. Often anime/manga focused. Redemption arcs, existentialism, and well-executed romances are a few of my favorite things.

question: Tyrion? Jealousy? What?
answer:
Well… under the cut for potential spoilers.

It makes more narrative sense to me than Dany going insane does; that being said, it hasn’t been set up super well. The first three episodes all set Tyrion up as having “divided loyalties” as Sansa said, between his family and between his queen (Daenerys). His faith and his desire to be accepted by his family is tragic. Even after he killed his father, Cersei’s tried to kill him, tried to kill Shae, always hated and feared him, after his father hurt him through his first wife even if the show cut Tysha and I’m still mad about it–he still tries to plead with Cersei. Like, we all know Cersei won’t listen to reason. But he tries because he desperately wants his family to accept him. He wants to forgive himself like Jaime struggles to do, for killing their father in Tyrion’s case, for killing Shae. As abusive as Tywin was, killing him and Shae devastated Tyrion. 

Also, Peter Dinklage made some curious (but not definitive) comments about falling in love with Dany, and the season 6 and 7 scripts appear to confirm that Tyrion is in love with Daenerys (here and here). I don’t think the show has done a great job of showing us that, but think back to Boatsex and Tyrion’s inexplicably odd face then, and his odd comments in episodes 1-3 of the past season.

I don’t think whatever Tyrion does to betray them is done out of malice. I think, like Jaime, he will try to save what he loves–his family (Cersei and Jaime, if he sees Jaime’s come back) and Daenerys. And because of that it’s likely to be a tragedy. Because sometimes you do have to choose. It might also echo Ned’s tragic way of trying to show mercy on Cersei only to have that backfire and wind up executed again (I’m guessing Tyrion’s execution would mimic Ned’s). 

Again, if. If is the key here. If. I do think it makes narrative sense, though.

title: Dear Game of Thrones Fans
body:
*spoilers*

Jon not petting Ghost, Daenerys starting to go slightly mad, Jaime leaving Brienne and a Starbucks coffee cup being in shot does not mean the show has gone to hell. You may not LIKE where the show is heading with it’s narrative and your favourite characters, I certainly don’t, but that does not mean the show is suddenly BAD.

Don’t confuse your personal grievances with narrative discrepancies.

tags: tell me if my tags are wrong
title: In defense of the North
body:
I want to address the accusation that the North’s lukewarm attitude towards Daenerys is blatant xenophobia or entirely due to the sins of the father. I think part of it stems from the lie that Jon tells to the entire hall of Winterfell in 8.01: 

“I had a choice: keep the crown or protect the North, I chose the North”

With this he tells men and women who are already hesitant about allying with a Targaryen (or any other Southern ruler) that Daenerys refused to help, despite knowing the scale of the threat, unless he bent the knee. In other words Jon implies that Daenerys would be willing to let the North perish if they did not subjugate themselves.

We, the viewers, know this is a lie but the North does not.

Jon presents Dany’s help almost as a business deal. She will fight for them and in return they recognise her as queen and help her defeat Cersei. One might be thankful for conditional aid but it does not exactly inspire love.

Moreover, Jon himself frames his decision as a negative one. He doesn’t argue that Daenerys is a good ruler, worthy of the crown, neither does Tyrion. No, he tells them he had no other choice. They needed allies or they would die.

tags: I had no hope from sansa but arya??
Give Arya and Daenerys the scene they deserve you cowards
summary: Remember how last season everyone was up Dany's ass for not trusting Jon immediately or helping him in his war with the Night...
body:
Remember how last season everyone was up Dany’s ass for not trusting Jon immediately or helping him in his war with the Night King to protect the Westeros and indirectly North?

Cut to this season Sansa and the North are not trusting Dany even after fighting for them in the long night!

She is not stranger to North anymore. She helped them fight their biggest enemy and in return we are getting Sansa brushing all her efforts with Arya won the war or Arya plainly acknowledging her help but want her to go back coz she “can never be us”.

Ooh and did we forget Sansa is conspiring against Dany.

Double Standards, much?

summary: OKAY, let me be positive for a sec. I think daenerys is completely 100% sane, idc what those dumb nonsensical leaks say. Bells...
body:
OKAY, let me be positive for a sec.

I think daenerys is completely 100% sane, idc what those dumb nonsensical leaks say. Bells being a trigger has never been established, it’s never been planted, it’s not gonna happen. Filmmaking 101.

I think she’s going to prove everyone wrong once the battle starts because there will be a lot of questioning and tension in Dragonstone at the beginning. She will take out Euron and the scorpions, well as many as she can and then open fire on the KL gates.

There will be a battle and it might seem like things are stacked against them, and then Golden Company turns their cloaks and starts fighting for Daenerys

I think Cersei is the one that will start behaving recklessly after the bells start to toll, perhaps using the people in the Keep as a shield against Daenerys and threatening lives, perhaps even killing people

I think Tyrion will try to save his sister and his brother’s child, but he will pay the ultimate price for it… his conscience, because he’ll have to keep Dany’s armies back

I think Jaime is going to prove essential in taking out Cersei in the end

I think Arya will mercy-kill the Hound after he’s done with the Mountain

I think they will set off a bunch of bombs in the Red Keep and many people will lose their lives cause they can’t get out

I think both Targaryens will abdicate after the horrifying scenes in Kingslanding, cause their home is not the IT, it’s their family (each other)

I think Daenerys is pregnant

Narratively, this is what SHOULD happen.

I think they will set off a bunch of bombs in the Red Keep and many people will lose their lives cause they can’t get out

I think both Targaryens will abdicate after the horrifying scenes in Kingslanding, cause their home is not the IT, it’s their family (each other)

I think Daenerys is pregnant

Narratively, this is what SHOULD happen.

trail.content_raw:
OKAY, let me be positive for a sec.

I think daenerys is completely 100% sane, idc what those dumb nonsensical leaks say. Bells being a trigger has never been established, it’s never been planted, it’s not gonna happen. Filmmaking 101.

I think she’s going to prove everyone wrong once the battle starts because there will be a lot of questioning and tension in Dragonstone at the beginning. She will take out Euron and the scorpions, well as many as she can and then open fire on the KL gates.

There will be a battle and it might seem like things are stacked against them, and then Golden Company turns their cloaks and starts fighting for Daenerys

I think Cersei is the one that will start behaving recklessly after the bells start to toll, perhaps using the people in the Keep as a shield against Daenerys and threatening lives, perhaps even killing people

I think Tyrion will try to save his sister and his brother’s child, but he will pay the ultimate price for it… his conscience, because he’ll have to keep Dany’s armies back

I think Jaime is going to prove essential in taking out Cersei in the end

I think Arya will mercy-kill the Hound after he’s done with the Mountain

I think they will set off a bunch of bombs in the Red Keep and many people will lose their lives cause they can’t get out

I think both Targaryens will abdicate after the horrifying scenes in Kingslanding, cause their home is not the IT, it’s their family (each other)

I think Daenerys is pregnant

Narratively, this is what SHOULD happen.
trail.content:
OKAY, let me be positive for a sec.

I think daenerys is completely 100% sane, idc what those dumb nonsensical leaks say. Bells being a trigger has never been established, it’s never been planted, it’s not gonna happen. Filmmaking 101.

I think she’s going to prove everyone wrong once the battle starts because there will be a lot of questioning and tension in Dragonstone at the beginning. She will take out Euron and the scorpions, well as many as she can and then open fire on the KL gates.

There will be a battle and it might seem like things are stacked against them, and then Golden Company turns their cloaks and starts fighting for Daenerys

I think Cersei is the one that will start behaving recklessly after the bells start to toll, perhaps using the people in the Keep as a shield against Daenerys and threatening lives, perhaps even killing people

I think Tyrion will try to save his sister and his brother’s child, but he will pay the ultimate price for it… his conscience, because he’ll have to keep Dany’s armies back

I think Jaime is going to prove essential in taking out Cersei in the end

I think Arya will mercy-kill the Hound after he’s done with the Mountain

I think they will set off a bunch of bombs in the Red Keep and many people will lose their lives cause they can’t get out

I think both Targaryens will abdicate after the horrifying scenes in Kingslanding, cause their home is not the IT, it’s their family (each other)

I think Daenerys is pregnant

Narratively, this is what SHOULD happen.

blog.name: the-girl-in-the-high-castle
blog.title: Lot's Wife
blog.description: 24. Anthropologist. I want to meet someone that makes me feel the way music does. History nerd and eternaly suffering from Anemoia. I sold my soul to The Man In The High Castle, Brian Fallon, Brandon Flowers and Tom Smith. Eternal love for Babylon Berlin and Halt and Catch Fire. Always in discussion mod for A Song of Ice and Fire and The Wheel of Time.                                                                             "I've always dreamed of classic cars and movie screens."

title: Karma in GoT.
body:
We all know many of the characters got to experience that karma is a bitch.

Just some of the examples:

Ned Stark - beheaded the deserter who was trying to warn them of the WW. Beheaded.

Jaime - crippled Bran. Lost his hand.

Rob - Broke his word, betrayed Frey’s trust. Betrayed and murdered.

Jorah - Tempered with slaves. Sold as slave together with Tyrion.

So, if we start looking at that direction, how about Dany and Cersei going out in wildfire? If we take it Cersei still has wildfire. Both of them have burned people alive before, and since, if that still counts, Dany can’t be harmed by fire, she would certainly go up in flames with wildfire. The final faceoff, both of them setting King’s Landing on fire and burning with it.
